revised_title: Conductivity of Sheets with Polygonal Holes and Superconducting Inclusions
tldr: The author uses conformal mapping techniques to study the change in conductivity of a sheet containing polygonal holes and superconducting inclusions. The study focuses on equilateral triangles, squares, and regular polygons, finding that the conductivity depends on the area fraction and shape of the holes. The results also apply to superconducting inclusions.
